page.title: 17Laurie Lee biography
page.content: Laurie Lee was born in Gloucestershire and educated in Slad and Stroud.At the age of 19 he travelled on foot to London then on through Spain where he was trapped by the outbreak of the Civil War. During the Second World War he worked for the Ministry of Information and made films in Cyprus and India. In 1950-51 he became curator of Eccentricities for the Festival of Britain,and was awarded the M.B.E. He has published four books of poems including {'Pocket poems'(1960)}.He has also writtten the best seller { {'Cider with Rosie'(1959) }and a sequel {'As I Walked Out One Midsummer Morning {'(1969)}. He is fond of travelling and Music and finds he walks best in Chelsea garret, in muddy meadows in Slad or certain Spanish Mountain Villages.
